episodeTitle: Franky's Past! The Day the Sea Train First Ran
description: CP9 reveals their true identities and demands the Pluton blueprints from Franky. The episode primarily features an extended flashback depicting young Franky's arrival at Water 7, his apprenticeship under legendary shipwright Tom, Tom's trial for building Gold Roger's ship, and the construction and maiden voyage of the revolutionary Sea Train.

events.title: CP9 Reveals Their True Identities to Franky
events.description: CP9 agents Kalifa, Blueno, Rob Lucci, and Kaku reveal their true identities as World Government agents to Franky. They expose that they have been working undercover at Galley-La Company and demand that Franky hand over the Pluton blueprints.
events.significance: This moment confirms the conspiracy against Water 7 and sets up the central conflict over the ancient weapon Pluton's blueprints, which were entrusted to Franky by Tom.

quotes.text: Tom entrusted the blueprints to Pluton to Iceburg, who then entrusted them to you. Hand over the blueprints, Franky.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: CP9 demanding the ancient weapon blueprints from Franky

events.title: CP9 Discovers Franky's Hidden Workshop
events.description: CP9 agents destroy the wall to Franky's secret workshop, exposing his hidden room containing blueprints and memories from his time at Tom's Workers. Franky fears they will trample his precious memories.
events.significance: The discovery of Franky's workshop triggers the flashback sequence and represents the violation of Franky's most sacred space containing his past with Tom.

events.title: Young Franky's First Appearance
events.description: Flashback begins showing young Franky (then known as Cutty Flam) arriving at Water 7 on Scrap Island aboard one of his self-made Battle Franky contraptions, firing cannonballs recklessly. Tom finds the 10-year-old boy who was abandoned by his pirate parents.
events.significance: Introduces Franky's tragic origin story and the beginning of his relationship with Tom, the legendary shipwright who would become his father figure and mentor.

quotes.text: My parents ditched me. They were probably pirates who couldn't handle my behavior.
quotes.speaker: Young Franky
quotes.context: Franky explaining how he ended up alone on Scrap Island

events.title: Tom's First Appearance
events.description: Tom, the legendary fish-man shipwright, is introduced. He discovers young Franky on Scrap Island and takes him in as an apprentice alongside Iceburg. Tom is shown as a kind, supportive mentor who encourages both boys in their shipbuilding pursuits.
events.significance: Tom is revealed as one of the most important figures in Franky's life and the builder of Gold Roger's ship, the Oro Jackson. His character embodies the philosophy that a shipwright must take pride in their creations.

quotes.text: A shipwright must always be proud of the ships they create, no matter what they're used for!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom teaching his core philosophy to his apprentices

events.title: Franky and Iceburg as Fellow Apprentices
events.description: The flashback shows young Franky and Iceburg working together as apprentices under Tom. Despite their different personalities - Franky being wild and chaotic, Iceburg being more serious and responsible - they form a brotherly bond while learning shipbuilding.
events.significance: Establishes the deep history between Franky and Iceburg, explaining their complicated relationship in the present day and why the Pluton blueprints were passed between them.

events.title: Tom's Trial for Building Gold Roger's Ship
events.description: Judge Jorge presides over Tom's trial. Tom is sentenced to be executed at Enies Lobby for the crime of building the Oro Jackson, the ship that carried the Pirate King Gol D. Roger on his journey. Despite the death sentence, Tom proudly declares he has no regrets about building Roger's ship.
events.significance: This trial is a pivotal moment that reveals Tom built the Pirate King's ship and establishes the conflict between the World Government and Tom's Workers. It also demonstrates Tom's unwavering pride in his work, regardless of consequences.

quotes.text: I am proud to have built the ship that carried the Pirate King! I have no regrets!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's declaration at his trial, teaching his apprentices about pride in one's creations

events.title: Tom Proposes Building the Sea Train
events.description: Facing execution, Tom proposes a deal to Judge Jorge: give him 10 years to build a revolutionary Sea Train that runs on water, which will restore hope and prosperity to the struggling island of Water 7. If he succeeds, he will be pardoned. Jorge accepts the proposal.
events.significance: This decision sets in motion the creation of one of the most important technological achievements in the One Piece world. The Sea Train would save Water 7 from economic collapse and become Tom's legacy, though it would also lead to tragedy.

quotes.text: Give me ten years! I'll build a train that runs on the sea and save this island!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's proposal to build the Sea Train in exchange for his life

events.title: Yokozuna and Kokoro Join Tom's Workers
events.description: The flashback shows Yokozuna the frog and Kokoro the mermaid as part of Tom's Workers family. Yokozuna is kept as a pet and mascot, while Kokoro assists with the Sea Train project. Both characters are shown supporting Tom and his apprentices.
events.significance: Establishes the full family dynamic of Tom's Workers and shows the origins of Yokozuna's relationship with the Sea Train, which will later explain his behavior of challenging it.

events.title: Sea Train Construction Montage
events.description: An extended montage shows Tom, Franky, and Iceburg working together over many years to design, build, and test the Sea Train. The sequence depicts their struggles, including attacks by Sea Kings, technical challenges, and the passage of time as the apprentices grow.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dedication, teamwork, and perseverance required to achieve Tom's dream. The montage shows the strong bond formed between Tom and his apprentices during this decade-long project.

events.title: The Puffing Tom's Maiden Voyage
events.description: After ten years of construction, the Sea Train 'Puffing Tom' successfully completes its maiden voyage. The citizens of Water 7 gather to witness the historic moment as the train runs across the water for the first time, bringing hope and joy to the entire island.
events.significance: The successful maiden voyage represents the culmination of Tom's dream and proves that the Sea Train can save Water 7. This moment restores hope to the island and demonstrates Tom's genius as a shipwright, validating his decade of work.

quotes.text: Look! The Sea Train is running! Tom really did it!
quotes.speaker: Water 7 Citizens
quotes.context: Citizens celebrating the maiden voyage of the Puffing Tom

events.title: Water 7's Economic Revival
events.description: The episode shows how the Sea Train transformed Water 7 from a struggling, isolated island into a prosperous hub. The train enables easy movement of goods and people, boosting the economy and bringing prosperity to the citizens.
events.significance: Establishes the Sea Train as one of the most important technological achievements in the One Piece world and shows Tom's lasting impact on Water 7. The economic revival proves Tom's worth and sets up his eventual pardon attempt.

events.title: Jorge's Return to Water 7
events.description: Judge Jorge returns to Water 7 after fourteen years, fascinated by the Sea Train's success. He plans to permanently pardon Tom for his achievement in building the revolutionary transportation system.
events.significance: Jorge's return represents the fulfillment of Tom's deal and the promise of his freedom. However, this moment of hope will be tragically short-lived due to Spandam's interference in the next episode.

themes.description: Tom teaches that a shipwright must take pride in their creations regardless of how they're used. This philosophy becomes central to both Franky and Iceburg's character development.
themes.symbolism: Tom's pride in building Roger's ship despite it leading to his trial represents unwavering dedication to one's craft.

themes.description: Tom's ten-year project to build the Sea Train demonstrates that great dreams require dedication, hard work, and perseverance through challenges.
themes.symbolism: The Sea Train represents hope, progress, and the power of innovation to transform society.

themes.description: Tom's Workers function as a found family, with Tom becoming a father figure to the abandoned Franky and supporting Iceburg. The episode emphasizes that family bonds can be chosen, not just inherited.
themes.symbolism: Tom taking in Franky mirrors the overarching One Piece theme of found families and crews.

themes.description: Tom's genius as a shipwright brings both glory and persecution. Building Roger's ship showcases his skill but also brings a death sentence from the World Government.

characterSpotlights.development: Tom is introduced as a legendary shipwright with unwavering principles. His character embodies pride in craftsmanship, mentorship, and self-sacrifice for the greater good.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist in both present and flashback
characterSpotlights.development: The episode reveals Franky's tragic origin as an abandoned child who found purpose and family with Tom. His wild, chaotic nature is shown to have existed since childhood, but Tom channeled it into shipbuilding.

characterSpotlights.development: Young Iceburg is shown as the more responsible apprentice who often clashed with Franky's reckless nature, but they formed a brotherly bond under Tom's guidance.

Often argues with Franky about his dangerous Battle Franky projects

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the Sea Train construction montage with additional scenes of the apprentices working together and facing challenges.
Additional dialogue and character moments between young Franky and Iceburg are added to flesh out their relationship.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Tom in the anime, who is revealed as the builder of Gold Roger's ship and Franky's mentor.
The episode features a cameo appearance by Pandaman, the recurring Easter egg character in One Piece.
The episode aired with an 11.2% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for its timeslot.
A nameplate in the episode displays 'Icebarg', an alternative romanization of Iceburg's name.
The ending song 'Dear Friends' by TRIPLANE is dedicated to the Going Merry and later plays during the ship's funeral in Episode 312.
This episode was directed by Hiroaki Miyamoto and written by Hirohiko Kamisaka, with animation direction by Kazuya Hisada.
Young Mozu appears with blue eyes in this episode, though her eyes are typically hazel. This may be an animation interpretation of her wearing sunglasses.
